title: YouTrip | Senior Software Engineer - mid level | Chennai
content:
Education: Tier-3
Years of Experience: 5 years 4 months
Current Experience: SDE 2 at E-Commerce
Current salary: 46 LPA (36 LPA base , 10 LPA Esops)
Date of the Offer: July
Company: Youtrip
Title/Level:  Senior Software Engineer - mid level  
Location: Chennai
Salary: 41.4 LPA base
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 41LPA first year

Rejected the offer
1. Recruited justified the numbers by considering ESOPs as paper money so valued it at 0 and hike of 15% on 36 LPA fixed
2. Recruiter also mentioned that since I said I had no Expectation and was comfortable with the pay for my experience and role , they thought I would accept the offer 
3. Initially 39.6 LPA was offered.

R1- DSA - min steps to convert binary string to 0 - you can divide by 2 and subract it by -1)
R2- SD -  Manage product inventory and user data. Implement search, reviews, transactions, and personalized recommendations. Ensure secure payment processing and fraud detection.
R3 - Behavioral / leadership / HM round

title: GROWW | SDE 3 | Bengaluru
content:
Education: Tier-3
Years of Experience: 5 years 4 months
Current Experience: SDE 2 at E-Commerce
Current salary: 46 LPA (36 LPA base , 10 LPA Esops)
Date of the Offer: July
Company: GROWW
Title/Level: SDE 3
Location: Bengaluru
Salary: 47 LPA base , 5L performance linked variable
Relocation/Signing Bonus: 1.5 lakhs relocation reimburesment (with bills)
Stock bonus: 8 lakhs per year ( 32 LPA over 4)
Bonus:
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 60LPA first year (inlucding variable excluding relocation benefit)

Rejected the offer

less than 30% hike.
Groww had 4 tech rounds + 1 HR round and all rounds went well, still no room for negotiation. The recruiter mentioned that Groww Share is internally valued at 2X than current rate since last funding happened in 2021.
Will add interview experience if interested.
salaryTotal: : 60lpa First Year (inlucding Variable Excluding Relocation Benefit)

title: Google | L3 | Bengaluru
content:
Sharing my Google offer details:

* Education: B. Tech in CSE from Tier-3
* Years of Experience: 3
* Prior Experience: One of FAANGs, one big fintech firm 
* Previous Comp: 33L base + 2L perf bonus INR
* Date of the Offer: Sept 2024
* Company: Google
* Title/Level: L3
* Location: Bengaluru
* Salary: 21.9L base + 1.47L retirals INR
* Signing Bonus: 3L INR
* Stock bonus: 46.5K USD (vesting fractions - 38%, 32%, 20%, 10%)
* Bonus: 15% performance bonus (= 3.28L INR)
* Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): First year comp ~ 44.35L INR
* Benefits: Standard Google benefits

I was given a choice to re-balance this comp structure for slightly more base and lesser equity, but I choose the above-mentioned structure.

I accepted the offer. I know some of you would think that I shouldn't have done so as it's a low-balled/down-levelled offer, but at the end of the day, it was my personal decision to accept the offer and I'm happy :)

Also, I do not remember my interview questions so won't be able to help you all with that.

title: Probo | SWE | Gurgaon | September 2024
content:
Education: B.Tech from a tier 1.5 institue
yoe: 2+
Prior experience: Worked at Microsoft
current TC: 20L base, 8L RSU

Date of offer: September 2024
Company: Probo
Title/Level: Software Engineer
Location: Gurgaon
Salary: 27.5L base
Stock bonus: 8L worth of esops at per unit price of 30Rs
Bonus: none
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 27.5L + 0L + 8L
Other details: 5 day work from office

I feel this offer is too low-balled, so I declined. They couldn't go beyong the 27.5L base even after showing them a compete offer of 30+ LPA base.

Interview experience: https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/5612034/Probo-or-SWE-or-Gurgaon-or-Aug-2024
